fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: If you have a Rails app and use timestamps in your table creation migrations, you'll have a created_at attribute on most if not all of your models.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: If you have a Rails app and use timestamps in your table creation migrations, you'll have a updated_at attribute on most if not all of your models.

methods.name: becomeDirty
methods.description:
Force the model's state to dirty.

You could use this function after you've edited a model's relationships so that your Ember application knows that the model may need to be saved.

methods.name: transitionToInFlight
methods.description:
If you're manually saving a model, you could borrow this helper function to make sure the model is marked as dirty and it's transitioned to inFlight.

This method depends on accessing the _internalModel field.

methods.name: transitionToSaved
methods.description:
If you're manually saving a model, you could borrow this helper function to make sure the model is marked as saved and supplied payload is pushed into the store.

This method depends on accessing the _internalModel field.

params.name: payload
params.description: the API server payload that will be pushed into the Ember Data `store`

methods.name: transitionToUncommitted
methods.description:
If you're manually saving a model, you can borrow this helper method in your error/catch block to transition the model to uncommitted and process all of the payload errors.

This method depends on accessing the _internalModel field.

params.name: payload
params.description:
the API server payload that includes the error messages that will be appended
to the model's `errors` collection.

accessors.name: altered?
accessors.description:
Returns true if the instance has been altered since creation; false otherwise.

Has the model has been altered since creation? Determined by comparing the createdAt timestamp against the updatedAt timestamp.

accessors.name: clean?
accessors.description:
Return true if the model has not had any of its attributes edited; false otherwise.

Negation of the model's hasDirtyAttributes property.

accessors.name: dirty?
accessors.description:
Return true if the model is dirty and at least one attribute has been edited; false otherwise.

Read-only peek at the model's hasDirtyAttributes property.

accessors.name: new?
accessors.description:
Return true if the model is new and has not yet been persisted; false otherwise.

Read-only peek at the model's isNew property.

accessors.name: persisted?
accessors.description:
Return true if the instance has been persisted to the store; false otherwise.

Negation of the isNew property, meaning that the model has been persisted permanently to the store.

accessors.name: unaltered?
accessors.description:
Return true if the instance is unchanged since creation; false otherwise.

Is the model unchanged since creation? Basically the negation of altered?.
